info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 9:50AM EDT until April 05 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT FOR VAN BUREN...ALLEGAN AND WESTERN KALAMAZOO COUNTIES... At 948 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Martin, or 6 miles east of Allegan, moving northeast at 65 mph. Additional thunderstorms were located along the Lake Michigan shore. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Kalamazoo... Portage... Holland... Allegan... South Haven... Paw Paw... Wayland... Otsego... Plainwell... Hartford... Mattawan... Lawton... Bangor... Decatur... Fennville... Saugatuck... Martin... Van Buren SP... Westwood... Lake Michigan Beach... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for southwestern Michigan. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
